answers.answer: Hi!The MRI does not indicate any apparent cause for left side numbness. Degenerative or wear and tear changes have just started and unlikely to cause any pressure on cord or spinal nerves. The numbness could be due to peripheral neuropathies as seen in diabetes, hypothyroidism, Lyme’s or lupus. Please consult your doctor regarding this. Hope this helps. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.
thank you,  if you get a chance could you please look at the other 2 mri i have posted

question: Anyone know what it means.....MRI-3T LUMBAR SPINE W/O CONHISTORY: Left-sided numbness, evaluate for demyelinating disease.TECHNIQUE: MR imaging of the lumbar spine was performed without contrast on a 3.0 Tesla high-fieldwide-bore magnet.COMPARISON: NoneFINDINGS:ALIGNMENT: There is no scoliosis.BONES: Vertebral body heights are maintained. Marrow signal is within normal limits.CONUS: Normal in signal and morphology. Terminates at L1-L2.DISCS: The intervertebral discs are well-hydrated. See details below.T12-L1: There is minimal disc bulging without significant central or foraminal stenosis.L1-L2: There is minimal disc bulging without significant central or foraminal stenosis.L2-L3 : There is no disc bulge, herniation, central or foraminal stenosis.L3-L4 : There is no disc bulge, herniation, central or foraminal stenosis.L4-L5: There is mild bilateral facet arthropathy and minimal disc bulging without significant central orforaminal stenosis. There is minimal left foraminal narrowing.L5-S1: There is no disc bulge, herniation, central or foraminal stenosis. There is mild bilateral facetarthropathy.There are a few scattered renal cysts noted.IMPRESSION:Minimal degenerative changes without stenosis or nerve root compression.No evidence of demyelinating disease in the visualized lower cord.
title: mri results#1
